commit_message:
Remove ~/.config/openstack/clouds.yml in clean.sh

In some circumstances, the file ~/.config/openstack/clouds.yml can
become stale and cause the "openstack" command to fail while running
stack.sh.  Currently, clean.sh tries to clean this up, twice, but
does it wrong each time.  This patch just tries once but hopefully
does it right.

Change-Id: Ic4580127c51187b65fab2c055abb2e4ed50a4551
Closes-Bug: 1529025
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/98/286898/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: DIRS_TO_CLEAN="$WHEELHOUSE ${PROJECT_VENV[@]} ~/.config/openstack"
deleted_lines: DIRS_TO_CLEAN="$WHEELHOUSE ${PROJECT_VENV[@]} .config/openstack"FILES_TO_CLEAN+="~/.config/openstack"

subject: Add Management Network For System Administration.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-07 20:58:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/8944a1f87fb4dc6480f5940e516d194ae1aac3b5', 'message': "Add Management Network For System Administration.

This change adds a system management network to all overcloud
nodes. The purpose of this network is for system administration,
for access to infrastructure services like DNS or NTP, or for
monitoring. This allows the management network to be placed on a
bond for redundancy, or for the system management network to be
an out-of-band network with no routing in or out. The management
network might also be configured as a default route instead of the
provisioning 'ctlplane' network.

This change does not enable the management network by default. An
environment file named network-management.yaml may be included to
enable the network and ports for each role. The included NIC config
templates have been updated with a block that may be uncommented
when the management network is enabled.

commit_message:
Add Management Network For System Administration.

This change adds a system management network to all overcloud
nodes. The purpose of this network is for system administration,
for access to infrastructure services like DNS or NTP, or for
monitoring. This allows the management network to be placed on a
bond for redundancy, or for the system management network to be
an out-of-band network with no routing in or out. The management
network might also be configured as a default route instead of the
provisioning 'ctlplane' network.

This change does not enable the management network by default. An
environment file named network-management.yaml may be included to
enable the network and ports for each role. The included NIC config
templates have been updated with a block that may be uncommented
when the management network is enabled.

This change also contains some minor cleanup to the NIC templates,
particularly the multiple nic templates.

Change-Id: I0813a13f60a4f797be04b34258a2cffa9ea7e84f
(cherry picked from commit 15bb67261a333f140f21208e20a112b99eeb609c)

Only populated when including environments/network-management.yaml default: '' description: IP address/subnet on the management network type: string ExternalNetworkVlanID: default: 10 description: Vlan ID for the external network traffic. type: number InternalApiNetworkVlanID: default: 20 description: Vlan ID for the internal_api network traffic. type: number StorageNetworkVlanID: default: 30 description: Vlan ID for the storage network traffic. type: number StorageMgmtNetworkVlanID: default: 40 description: Vlan ID for the storage mgmt network traffic. type: number TenantNetworkVlanID: default: 50 description: Vlan ID for the tenant network traffic. type: number ManagementNetworkVlanID: default: 60 description: Vlan ID for the management network traffic. type: number ExternalInterfaceDefaultRoute: default: '10.0.0.1' description: default route for the external network type: string ControlPlaneSubnetCidr: # Override this via parameter_defaults default: '24' description: The subnet CIDR of the control plane network. type: string ControlPlaneDefaultRoute: # Override this via parameter_defaults description: The default route of the control plane network. type: string DnsServers: # Override this via parameter_defaults default: [] description: A list of DNS servers (2 max for some implementations) that will be added to resolv.conf. type: comma_delimited_list EC2MetadataIp: # Override this via parameter_defaults description: The IP address of the EC2 metadata server. type: string resources: OsNetConfigImpl: type: OS::Heat::StructuredConfig properties: group: os-apply-config config: os_net_config: network_config: - type: interface name: nic1 use_dhcp: false dns_servers: {get_param: DnsServers} addresses: - ip_netmask: list_join: - '/' - - {get_param: ControlPlaneIp} - {get_param: ControlPlaneSubnetCidr} routes: - ip_netmask: 169.254.169.254/32 next_hop: {get_param: EC2MetadataIp} - type: interface name: nic2 use_dhcp: false addresses: - ip_netmask: {get_param: StorageIpSubnet} - type: interface name: nic3 use_dhcp: false addresses: - ip_netmask: {get_param: StorageMgmtIpSubnet} - type: interface name: nic4 use_dhcp: false addresses: - ip_netmask: {get_param: InternalApiIpSubnet} - # Create a bridge which can also be used for VLAN-mode bridge mapping type: ovs_bridge name: br-tenant use_dhcp: false addresses: - ip_netmask: {get_param: TenantIpSubnet} members: - type: interface name: nic5 use_dhcp: false # force the MAC address of the bridge to this interface primary: true - type: ovs_bridge name: {get_input: bridge_name} dns_servers: {get_param: DnsServers} use_dhcp: false addresses: - ip_netmask: {get_param: ExternalIpSubnet} routes: - default: true next_hop: {get_param: ExternalInterfaceDefaultRoute} members: - type: interface name: nic6 # git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/53/289853/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Test overcloud:: tripleo-common/scripts/tripleo.sh --overcloud-pingtest Requirements for testing the overcloud: overcloud.rc file (Located by default in the undercloud current user’s directory). This option will check that the overcloud is able to create a stack, testing several OpenStack components in the process. The following steps are made in order to check the stack creation: - Download a Fedora image and upload it to glance with the name pingtest_image. - Create an external neutron network called nova. - Create a subnet in the nova network. - Create a test stack called tenant-stack using heat and adding it to the nova network. - Get and ping the current IP address of the new stack. After the test the created resources are deleted.

commit_message:
go: O_TMPFILE

Abstract temporary file creation in the object server.
Support for O_TMPFILE on newer linux kernels.

Also replace all AtomicWriteFile calls with the new abstraction,
so we don't have .tmp-o-file problems anymore.

Change-Id: I5ef42896984032b095d574fac21533f9839152a3

commit_message:
Un-wrap function

This function didn't need to be wrapped and it's confusing to
readers trying to figure out why it would be, so un-wrap it.
No reason to have unnecessarily confusing code.

commit_message:
Add debug option for running tests

The debug option allows you to run tests easily
with break points in them. Allowing you to debug
the code easier.
To run call `tox -e debug <test_name>`

Change-Id: Iff0f5ee7e448383f03c9dca091f94226cda398d5

commit_message:
Move db migration added during Mitaka to proper directory

DB migrations related to VPNaaS endpoint groups and Multiple local
subnets were added during Mitaka dev cycle. They are accidently
placed in liberty directory. We can safely move these files
as db migrations do not depend on file paths.

Closes-Bug: #1553769
Change-Id: I54dd86bb302bed8564430a32012b849f0315d427

Add the service type to the project page title

This has the advantage of including the service type in the list of projects
which gives readers some extra context in an otherwise potentially bewildering
list of names.

commit_message:
Add enabled_apis option in nova compute install

If not config enabled_apis option in nova compute node, this will
cause nova-compute error.

This patch add enabled_apis in nova compute install section.

commit_message:
Support TOSCA definitions for applications

TOSCA is a standard developed under OASIS foundation. It is aimed
to cover definition of complex enterprise applications which might
consist of different loosely coupled components. Components can be
tied by using requirements and capabilities which are part of
TOSCA standard. As TOSCA covers most of the Applications aspects
(excluding application compilation and build) it should be
straightforward to support TOSCA format in murano. TOSCA is
adopted by enterprises so it will allow the openstack ecosystem to
integrate with enterprise IT applications.

Partially Implements: blueprint support-tosca-format

Change-Id: I79d57e838bd7c8ec054194b87d146f505eec6f75
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-specs refs/changes/22/194422/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Support TOSCA definitions for applications ========================================== URL of launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/murano/+spec/support-tosca-format TOSCA is a standard developed under OASIS foundation. It is aimed to cover definition of complex enterprise applications which might consist of different loosely coupled components. Components can be tied by using requirements and capabilities which are part of TOSCA standard. As TOSCA covers most of the Applications aspects (excluding application compilation and build) it should be straightforward to support TOSCA format in Murano. TOSCA is adopted by enterprises so it will allow OpenStack ecosystem to integrate with enterprise IT applications. The suggested approach for adding TOSCA support to Murano is to leverage the Heat-Translator project, which is an OpenStack project. Heat-Translator is a command line tool that takes non-Heat templates (e.g., TOSCA templates) as an input and produces a Heat Orchestration Template (HOT) which can then be deployed by Heat. Problem description =================== Murano currently does not support TOSCA and TOSCA based applications. With the growing popularity of TOSCA for describing application orchestrations it would be nice if Murano supports TOSCA based orchestration templates. Proposed change =============== In order to support TOSCA there are a couple of use cases that need to be implemented in Murano: *package-create / package-import* These commands are currently used to create application definition archives from HOT templates (diagram below). +------------------+ +------------------+ | Murano | | Heat | +--------+---------+ +---------+--------+ | | package-create(HOT) | | +---------------------> +++ | | | | <---------------------+ +++ | application definition | | archive (HOT ADA) | | | | | | package-import (HOT ADA) | | +---------------------> +++ Validate(HOT) | | | +--------------------> +++ | | | | | | <--------------------+ +++ | | OK | | | | | | +-----+ add component | | | | to catalog | | | <-----+ along with | <---------------------+ +++ its HOT | OK | template | | | + + Murano should be able to create similar application definition archives from TOSCA templates (diagram below). +------------------+ +------------------+ | Murano | | Heat Translator | +--------+---------+ +---------+--------+ | | package-create(TOSCA) | | +---------------------> +++ | | | | <---------------------+ +++ | application definition | | archive (TOSCA ADA) | | | | | | package-importr(TOSCA ADA) | | +---------------------> +++ Validate(TOSCA) | | | +--------------------> +++ | | | | | | <--------------------+ +++ | | OK | | | | | | +-----+ add component | | | | to catalog | | | <-----+ along with | <---------------------+ +++ its TOSCA | OK | template | | | + + *Deploying an environment* For HOT based packages Murano deploys one Heat stack per component. Even if two components are in the same environment they are deployed as their own stack and independent of each other (diagram below) +----------------+ +----------------+ | Murano | | Heat | +--------+-------+ +--------+-------+ deploy enV | | +-----------------------------------> +++ | | | | +-------+------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | loop | | | | | +-------+ +------+---------------------------------------------------------+ | |[for each | opt | | | | | | |component +------+ | | deploy component's HOT | | | |in env] |[if component | | +--------------------------------> +++ | | | |is not already | | | | | | | |deployed] | | <--------------------------------+ +++ | | | | | | deployed stack info | | | | | | | | | | | +----------------------------------------------------------------+ | | | | | | +--------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | | | +-------+------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | loop | | | | | +-------+ | | remoVe component's stack | | |[for each previously | | +--------------------------------> +++ | |deployed component | | | | | |removed from env] | | <--------------------------------+ +++ | | | | OK | | | | | | | +--------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | | | <-----------------------------------+ +++ | OK + + A similar behavior can be be achieved by introducing TOSCA templates. Since a TOSCA based package is stored with its TOSCA template (and not the corresponding HOT template), the TOSCA template needs to be translated first (diagram below). +----------------+ +------------------+ +----------------+ | Murano | | Heat Translator | | Heat | +--------+-------+ +---------+--------+ +--------+-------+ deploy enV | | | +-----------------------------------> +++ | | | | | | +-------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | loop | | | | | | +-------+ +------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | |[for each | opt | | | | | | | |component +------+ | | translate component's TOSCA | | | | |in env] |[if component | | +--------------------------------> +-+ | | | | |is not already | | |-| | | | | |deployed] | | <--------------------------------+ +-+ | | | | | | | component's HOT | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | deploy component's HOT | | | | | | | +--------------------------------------------------------------------> +-+ | | | | | | | |-| | | | | | | <--------------------------------------------------------------------+ +-+ | | | | | | | deployed stack info | | | | | | | | | | | | +-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | | | | | | | +----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | | | | | | | | +-------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | loop | | | | | | +-------+ | | remoVe component's stack | | | |[for each previously | | +--------------------------------------------------------------------> +-+ | |deployed component | | | |-| | |removed from env] | | <--------------------------------------------------------------------+ +-+ | | | | OK | | | | | | | | | +----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ |-| | | <-----------------------------------+ +-+ | | OK + + + Alternatives ------------ An alternative to automatically detecting the format for package-create is having the user provide it as a command line argument. This will require updating the corresponding REST API. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Versioning impact ------------------------- This should not have any negative impact on versioning. Older versions of Murano would still not support TOSCA based templates. And the new version would work with HOT based templates the same way as before. Other end user impact --------------------- TBD Deployer impact --------------- As a result of this implementation Heat-Translator would have to be enabled in the OpenStack environment. Developer impact ---------------- None Murano-dashboard / Horizon impact --------------------------------- Murano would need to represent TOSCA based components using a TOSCA specific logo, to distinguish them from HOT based components (probably not a Horizon impact). Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Vahid Hashemian (I would be happy to take the lead on this, but I am hoping I could leverage the existing knowledge on Murano development by having a co-contributor who knows Murano code well). Other contributors: TBD Work Items ---------- In order to support the above use cases Murano needs to add functionality for the pieces where it communicates with Heat-Translator. This is a break-down of the smaller work items: * Detect template format when creating a package: If the format is HOT proceed as before, but if it is TOSCA branch out for TOSCA specific processing. Ideally Murano would automatically detect the format. * Populate other metadata fields based on detected format when creating a package: Some metadata are different between HOT and TOSCA formats. * Include all imported TOSCA templates when creating a package: A TOSCA template may import other TOSCA templates. They all need to be imported into the package. * Detect format when importing a package and call Heat-Translator to validate if the format is TOSCA. * When importing a TOSCA package store its TOSCA template in the database: Each TOSCA based package needs to be stored along with its TOSCA template. * When deploying a component if the format is TOSCA first call Heat-Translator to translate it into HOT: Then call Heat for deploying the HOT template as before. Dependencies ============ Aside from what needs to be implemented inside Murano project, Heat-Translator would need to implement a couple of new functionalities: * Implementing a Python client: Heat-Translator does not currently have a Python CLI similar to other OpenStack projects. But until this client is implemented its command line utility script can be invoked by Murano. * Heat-Translator currently does not support full validation of TOSCA templates. Workaround is to call the translator and report errors, if any. To do so, an option has to be added so it does not expect input parameters (and just translates to HOT instead of translation and deployment) in case the TOSCA template requires inputs (`related bug <https://bugs.launchpad.net/heat-translator/+bug/1464024>`_). Testing ======= TBD Documentation Impact ==================== Until the time when Heat-Translator implements a Python CLI like other OpenStack projects the required configuration to connect Murano and Heat-Translator needs to be documented. References ========== * `Mailing List Discussion http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/065424.html`_

commit_message:
Increase default netdev_max_backlog to 10x

It has been observed that on large clouds the netdev backlog
buffer might overflow. This change increases the default by ten
times.

The /proc/net/softnet_stat file contains a counter in the 2nd
column that is incremented when the netdev backlog queue overflows.
If this value is incrementing over time, then netdev_max_backlog
needs to be increased [1].

[1]. https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1283676

Change-Id: Iec12324fd3a24e8b608b1e1849c270cc24cb0e60

commit_message:
Revert "Fix for ensurability of ceph"

Looks like this commit introduced a regression:
class ceph::ephemeral passes 'images_type' as a value

This reverts commit 038ab3861e010a36e5ee9fc95cbae3f2befa505a.
Closes-bug: #1554090

Change-Id: I55af63df43f342e7f285075c20a4025655843093

commit_message:
Update manuals to use new ``use_neutron`` option

Starting in Mitaka there is a unified use_neutron option that enables
both the network api and security group api. This is prefered over the
class based options which are now deprecated.

Change-Id: I3b682a1482f406e16cefa05b3a25d5cb2798097f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/08/289908/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: network_api_class = nova.network.neutronv2.api.API

commit_message:
Add a new tool to help find the latest versions

As we will be switching to pinning versions in Kolla this tool will
help remove the 'manual' part of that equation by looking up the
versions we want.

The idea would be to eventually turn this into an autoproposal bot so
we only ever need to approve changes.

More work can be done here like automatically updating the
kolla-build.conf

Co-Authored-By: Martin André <m.andre@redhat.com>
Partially-Implements: blueprint upgrade-kolla

Change-Id: I052159850b2579ca6db79be71672be382be8a3a3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/81/248481/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env python import re from bs4 import BeautifulSoup as bs import requests MAP = { 'ceilometer': 5, 'cinder': 7, 'designate': 1, 'glance': 11, 'gnocchi': 1, 'heat': 5, 'horizon': 8, 'ironic': 4, 'keystone': 8, 'magnum': 1, 'murano': 1, 'neutron': 7, 'nova': 12, 'swift': 2, 'zaqar': 1 } tarballs = 'http://tarballs.openstack.org' for project in sorted(MAP): series = MAP[project] base = '{}/{}'.format(tarballs, project) r = requests.get(base) s = bs(r.text, 'html.parser') winner = tuple() for link in s.find_all('a'): version = link.get('href') if (version.endswith('.tar.gz') and version.startswith('{}-{}'.format(project, series))): split = '{}-|.tar.gz'.format(project) candidate = tuple(re.split(split, version)[1].split('.')) # We favor the shorter tuple here so 1.0.0 will win over 1.0.0.0b1 if len(candidate) < len(winner): winner = candidate else: winner = max(candidate, winner) if winner == tuple(): print('Could not find version for {}'.format(project)) continue path = '{}/{}-{}.tag.gz'.format(base, project, '.'.join(winner)) print('Latest {}:\r\t\t\t{}'.format(project, path))

commit_message:
Permits configuration of Cinder enabled_backend via hieradata

It is currently possible to provide arbitrary config settings for
Cinder using the "cinder::config::cinder_config:" hiera key. To add
a backend though particular one has to edit the list of enabled
backends in Cinder too which isn't possible. This change will make
it possible using a user-customizable array of backends to be enabled.

Change-Id: Ic664c1c2b0f7b1b4b6be8b5064a38650694d4857
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/34/269534/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: enabled_backends => union($cinder_enabled_backends, hiera('cinder_user_enabled_backends')),
deleted_lines: enabled_backends => $cinder_enabled_backends,

commit_message:
Scenario guide for macvtap ml2 driver + agent

The scenario guide explains the architecture of an Openstack cloud
that uses macvtap agent/driver, explains packet flows and shows
an example configuration.

commit_message:
Reset instance progress when LM finishes

Currently we do not reset instance progress when live migration
finishes. Operator might end up with VMs that have progress set to,
e.g., 92% and ACTIVE state which means nothing and is confusing.
This patch resets instance progress in post_live_migration and
rollback_live_migration.

Change-Id: Ic5ceb7d376f638b8a8804a9473d2e7e2f484c23f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/62/277362/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: instance.progress = 0 instance.progress = 0

commit_message:
Only use screen when terminal is tty

Seems that our jenkins CI runs in an environment without a tty.
As a result the screen formatter fails in this environment. This
patch conditional uses screen or text formatter depending on the
TTY.

Change-Id: Ia661b4b56827bc07e86ab796d71db5f7528dc4ef
Closes-Bug: #1551431

commit_message:
Protocol validation to convert numbers to types

Currently the validation of specified protocol numbers does
not take into account registered numbers for protocols TCP,
UDP, ICMP, ICMPv6 et.al. The fix for the Bug 1215181 is to
validate protocol numbers given and convert them to type for
known ones, so that duplication can be avoided. If an unknown
number is specified it retains the older behavior and checks
only if it is within the range.

This tempest change is dependent on
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/271301/

Change-Id: Ib6aa468673af304f6a7328531eb290e4c4fecdb7
Closes-Bug: #1215181

deleted_lines: protocol = 17 protocol=protocol self.assertEqual(int(sec_group_rule['protocol']), protocol)

commit_message:
Heat stack was not always deleted

HeatStack.delete() method didn't check stack timestamps
before deletion. As a result it couldn't correctly detect the
fact that delete already started. So it could get UPDATE_COMPLETE
status from last operation instead and fail because it wasn't expected.

Closes-Bug: #1548567
Change-Id: I66130f826c6f72562a7c36920b0decae63adf5e0

commit_message:
Prepare constraints file for periodic bitrot jobs

Neutron 'general' tox targets rely on the file starting from Liberty
since https://review.openstack.org/#/c/289280/

We should prepare the constraints file for tox consumption.

Though it's needed for Liberty only so far, Kilo branch also has the
constraints file in requirements repo, and hence it's safe to prepare it
in case some projects want to consume it in Kilo too.

Closes-Bug: #1554518
Change-Id: I81e9f271304827a9b6e3c270540b21c9d1c0184f

commit_message:
Fix noop and alarm history ttl for aodh

The alarm history ttl has been removed from ceilometer and should now
be set as part of the aodh configuration. This change removes the
check from the ceilometer tests and implements it for aodh.

Also change I48ec5711a507115d8b7cc167ae881cac4637622f removed the
*_hash variables but Change I30a3832a2277fcf54396cb9b13da6050adf85edd
added in node_hash which is now no longer defined. Since the latter
change landed after the removal of the *_hash vars and we do not gate
on noop we ended up with broken noop tests.

Change-Id: I37a7354dfdc5a9592fa244bc87f8ab4f3f924bdf
Closes-Bug: #1554146
Closes-Bug: #1554168

Updating README and HACKING files for oslo options

Updating REAMDME and HACKING to allow users to generate sample
config files if needed.

Change-Id: I388271f80d6fc89bbdf20522e9280445a6cbf43a

added_lines: oslo.config ----------- After adding new options to freezer-scheduler please use the following command to update the sample configuration file:: oslo-config-generator --config-file config-generator/scheduler.conf If you added support for a new oslo library, you have to edit the following file adding a new namespace for the new oslo library: for example adding oslo.db:: # edit config-generator/scheduler.conf [DEFAULT] output_file = etc/scheduler.conf.sample wrap_width = 79 namespace = scheduler namespace = oslo.log namespace = oslo.db This will add oslo.db options to your configuration file. Agent Options ------------- To list options available in freezer-agent use the following command:: oslo-config-generator --namespace freezer --namespace oslo.log

subject: Allow min_l3_agents_per_router to equal one
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-08 13:42:09.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_hamode_db.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/683f86945d1e43a75544db73b063a5dd71d1facd', 'message': 'Allow min_l3_agents_per_router to equal one

As an operator, when I am running a setup with two network nodes, the
idea of running L3 HA is that an outage of one of the network nodes
should have minimum customer impact. With the current rules in place,
existing setups will indeed have little to no impact, but customers will
not be able to create new routers during the outage.

With this chance in place, we can set min_l3_agents_per_router=1, so the
customers will be affected even less. New routers will be created with
just one instance, which certainly is not optimal, but at least will
fulfill the customer request. Once the second network node recovers, the
second router instance will be added and thus redundancy restored.

Change-Id: I8a5fc74a96c784d474aefe2d9b27eeb66521ca82
'}]
commit_message:
Allow min_l3_agents_per_router to equal one

As an operator, when I am running a setup with two network nodes, the
idea of running L3 HA is that an outage of one of the network nodes
should have minimum customer impact. With the current rules in place,
existing setups will indeed have little to no impact, but customers will
not be able to create new routers during the outage.

With this chance in place, we can set min_l3_agents_per_router=1, so the
customers will be affected even less. New routers will be created with
just one instance, which certainly is not optimal, but at least will
fulfill the customer request. Once the second network node recovers, the
second router instance will be added and thus redundancy restored.

Change-Id: I8a5fc74a96c784d474aefe2d9b27eeb66521ca82
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/22/289922/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Make upload with --old-deploy-image only look for the old image

The use of --old-deploy-image should ONLY look for the old images, not the
new agent images as well. Only one of the image types should be sent into
glance. This change makes the upload process just look for the old images
when this flag is specified.

This functionality only exists in stable/liberty show the bug only exists
there, which is why this is going to stable/liberty directly.

Change-Id: I09d6da122b5c878e3d8a1f85b6f661ff8260867d
Closes-Bug: #1554544
Related-Bug: rhbz#1295912

commit_message:
glossary: normalize usage of upper/lower/capitalization

* Use lower case by default
* Use upper case for abbreviation
* Use capitalization for proper nouns like OpenStack service names

The basic policy follows OpenStack manuals glossary.

Change-Id: I44318cbeeb0cc7f7ccc249e383328e6e8f592f77

Rewrite update calls in dashboard

Rewriting acl updates and shares updates calls to allow
this methods not to update other important fields like
node processes and so on.

Change-Id: I629779bba8d780f518040180f594209d7933ddf1
Closes-bug: 1552166

commit_message:
Add Neutron flavor framework API documentation

Enhance the Neutron networking extension api with definitions
of the calls for the Neutron flavor framework extension.

Include the updates to LBaaSv2 api to use the flavor framework.

Change-Id: I798d263bb07faf5bc3379852c553a415c3e620b1

commit_message:
Remove anonymous mysql users

Since we're closer to packaged upstream, which may have default
anonymous users, remove them before creating our user to avoid issues
with default matching of 'localhost' [1]

[1] http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.7/en/adding-users.html

Change-Id: I5564ae9b54aa29ff60d7eb384cb1b64a70586815

answer.txt cat > /etc/sysconfig/network-scripts/ifcfg-br-eth0 <<EOF DEVICE=br-eth0 STP=yes TYPE="OVSBridge" DEVICETYPE="ovs" BOOTPROTO=none NAME="br-eth0" ONBOOT=yes NM_CONTROLLED=no DELAY=0 openstack-ironic-api openstack-ironic-conductor python-ironicclient sed -i 's/^\(connection=\).*/\1mysql:\/\/ironic:'$IRONIC_DBPASSWORD'@'$IRONIC_HOST'\/ironic?charset=utf8/' /etc/ironic/ironic.conf -e name=cn0 NODE_ID=`ironic node-list --detail | grep \'cn0\' | sed 's/.* \([0-9a-Z-]\+\) |[ ]*$/\1/'` ironic port-create -n $NODE_ID -a 00:25:90:54:87:9e sed -i '/-A INPUT -j nova-api-INPUT/a-A INPUT -p udp -m multiport --dports 69 -m comment --comment "001 tftp" -j ACCEPT' /etc/sysconfig/iptables LINE_NO=`iptables -L INPUT --line-numbers | grep nova-api-INPUT | awk '{print $1+1}'` iptables -I INPUT $LINE_NO -p udp -m multiport --dports 70 -m comment --comment "001 tftp" -j ACCEPT sed 's@/var/lib/tftpboot@/tftpboot@' /etc/xinetd.d/tftp chown ironic /tftpboot ln -s './' /tftpboot/tftpboot commit_message:
Install: Heat updates for Mitaka

Update heat configuration for Mitaka.

1) Remove explicit installation of some packages due to
   dependency fixes.
2) Remove explicit configuration of verbosity.
3) Use to the OpenStack client if possible.

Change-Id: I680c54849056a2763e397e55da343d234a32d567

commit_message:
Don't override the private_net settings for the tenant

In stable/liberty branch the overrides with -P don't seem to be
applied by the client (or heat), causing the deployment to fail with:

Cidr 10.0.0.0/8 of subnet 126de4ce-644f-4fb4-84db-3fb6142d8f9c overlaps with cidr 10.0.0.0/24

Change-Id: I5126887ff94f7a48d6b3160353b802539491de04
Depends-On: Ie21282eb8cc0a8767aceb270bb1c892cec51bf73
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/95/289495/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Allow a list of files to be copied into the container cache
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-08 12:40:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_hosts/commit/f39a1e7388d2962e56faceb96e3295407349a390', 'message': "Allow a list of files to be copied into the container cache

In order to better make use of OpenStack-CI's resources (apt mirrors, etc)
we need to be able to copy configuration files which have been implemented
on the host image into the containers.

This patch provides a facility to do this in a way that provides a new
facility for deployers to use, doesn't affect existing production
environments and is easy for us to consume in gate testing.

A new variable called 'lxc_container_cache_files' is implemented, which
is a dictionary specifying the location of the file on the deployment
system, where to put it, and what attributes to assign it.

An example of how to use it is included in the role's defaults as a comment.

Change-Id: Ia76b3a791239a07db1cb93636b7d1e23a6a6851c
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-08 12:44:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_hosts/commit/6b8c69234b0249e7dbdd94a948644ff990930523', 'message': "Allow a list of files to be copied into the container cache

commit_message:
Allow a list of files to be copied into the container cache

In order to better make use of OpenStack-CI's resources (apt mirrors, etc)
we need to be able to copy configuration files which have been implemented
on the host image into the containers.

This patch provides a facility to do this in a way that provides a new
facility for deployers to use, doesn't affect existing production
environments and is easy for us to consume in gate testing.

A new variable called 'lxc_container_cache_files' is implemented, which
is a list of dictionaries specifying the location of the file on the
deployment system, where to put it in the container cache, and what
attributes to assign the file.

An example of how to use it is included in the role's defaults as a comment.

Change-Id: Ia76b3a791239a07db1cb93636b7d1e23a6a6851c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_hosts refs/changes/98/289898/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # A list of files may be copied into the container image cache during its preparation. # Example: # lxc_container_cache_files: # - { src: "/etc/openstack_deploy/files/etc/issue", # dest: "/etc/issue" } lxc_container_cache_files: []

commit_message:
deprecate security_group_api config option

This deprecates the security_group_api config option and makes it
respect the new ``use_neutron`` option. This provides a much simpler
and consistent interface for enabling Neutron support in Nova.

Change-Id: I1c2eb51d10ba6370492a911f59370b9870646a38

deleted_lines: cfg.StrOpt('security_group_api', default='nova', help='The full class name of the security API class'), return CONF.security_group_api.lower() == 'neutron'

commit_message:
Add network templates for multiple NIC configuration

This change adds a set of network interface configurations for use
with network isolation. The multiple-nics templates includes one
separate NIC per network, and assumes that nic1 is used for the
provisioning network (ctlplane). Also included is an environment
file for including the multiple-nics configuration in a deployment.

This revision changes the ordering of the NICs. By doing that, it
is possible to wire up only a subset of the NICs for the storage
nodes, and it is possilbe to leave the External NIC only configured
on the controllers.

rdo: Updated this commit for static control plane configuration

gfidente: Includes Iabd835724848d754d5522968e1c8e3cf9f78e6c6 to
pass pep8 testing.

commit_message:
Also register license as context function

With that, it's also possible to use:

{{ license('Apache-2.0') }}

instead of the license filter.

Change-Id: I8ae133aa0f2bd6afdd74231a36d9aed8b850e379

commit_message:
Add a deprecation warning to the DB downgrade

DB downgrade doesn't be supported in OpenStack now. Glance will
remove it in N release. In M cycle, we should add a warning to users.

Closes-bug: #1501233
Implements: blueprint remove-db-downgrade
Change-Id: I2791d8421abc0ad6c4905d5ddaa3fa99f264e333

commit_message:
Fix the problem when parse config file

Mistral cannot parse configure file from command line
like this:
--config-file="/path/to/config_file"

So update the code to recognize configure file rightly.

Change-Id: I9f3c23d0437578c9714019c480785198c940d181
Closes-Bug: #1552146
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/49/287549/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if "=" in arg: conf_file_value = arg.split("=", 1)[1] else: conf_file_value = args[args.index(arg) + 1] args.remove(conf_file_value) args.insert(0, "--config-file")
deleted_lines: conf_file_value = args[args.index(arg) + 1] args.remove(conf_file_value) args.insert(0, arg)

commit_message:
Make add_metrics_to_list side-effect free

It's odd that add_metrics_to_list takes a list only to extend it.
It's simpler to return a list (actually a MonitorMetricList) and
let the calling code do whatever it wants with it.

Refactored add_metrics_to_list into get_metric_objects which
returns a new list of metric objects.

Change-Id: Iec8e41c6f92184511e53da84df160ef9f4d6236c

added_lines: metrics.objects.extend(monitor.get_metric_objects())
deleted_lines: monitor.add_metrics_to_list(metrics)

commit_message:
Add use_default_subnetpool to subnet create requests

This follows up [1] by adding an extension to allow requesting the
default subnet pool explicitly through the API thus restoring the
convenience that was lost by removing the automatic default subnetpool
fallback behavior.

ApiImpact

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/279378/

Change-Id: Ifff57c0485e4727f352b2cc2bd1bdaabd0f1606b
Related-Bug: #1545199
Closes-Bug: #1547705
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/21/282021/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - The subnet API now includes a new use_default_subnetpool attribute. This attribute can be specified on creating a subnet in lieu of a subnetpool_id. The two are mutually exclusive. If it is specified as True, the default subnet pool for the requested ip_version will be looked up and used. If no default exists, an error will be returned. issues: - Before Mitaka, when a default subnetpool was defined in the configuration, a request to create a subnet would fall back to using it if no specific subnet pool was specified. This behavior broke the semantics of subnet create calls in this scenario and is now considered an API bug. This bug has been fixed so that there is no automatic fallback with the presence of a default subnet pool. Workflows which depended on this new behavior will have to be modified to set the new use_default_subnetpool attribute when creating a subnet. deprecations: - The default_subnet_pools option is now depracated for removal in the Newton release. The same functionality is now provided by setting is_default attribute on subnetpools to True using the API or client. fixes: - TODO Should the content of the 'issues' section be here instead? other: - TODO Or here?

subject: Make AllNodesExtraConfig depend on the validation deployments
revisions:

AllNodesExtraConfig should really only run after the validation
deployments are done, which validate that basic networking is
functioning.

In particular, creating a swap file during AllNodesExtraConfig while the
validation deployments are still running might cause temporary network
outages which could fail the validations.

Change-Id: Ia2a10318de47854a9b8932d72243ce0a85603556

(cherry picked from commit 0951c6e359edd2d34cd2bbd6a12278454a905258)

commit_message:
Make AllNodesExtraConfig depend on the validation deployments

AllNodesExtraConfig should really only run after the validation
deployments are done, which validate that basic networking is
functioning.

In particular, creating a swap file during AllNodesExtraConfig while the
validation deployments are still running might cause temporary network
outages which could fail the validations.

Change-Id: Ia2a10318de47854a9b8932d72243ce0a85603556
Partial-Bug: #1553243
(cherry picked from commit 0951c6e359edd2d34cd2bbd6a12278454a905258)

Fix v2.12 microversion REST API history doc

The attribute returned in the response body is 'net_id', not
'net-id'. We should be accurate in our REST API docs.

Related-Bug: #1496664

commit_message:
[Orchestration API v1] Fixes the type of "marker (Optional)" parameter

When listing events for a stack using Orchestration API v1, in the Request
Parameters table, the type of 'marker' parameter is "xsd:string".
Actually, it must be "String".
This patch updates the type of 'marker' parameter from "xsd:string" to String.

Change-Id: I758a7cc2c52d43b5db7a2b57567d8899e8d65c22
Closes-Bug: #1553021
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/api-site refs/changes/65/288265/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: style="query" required="false" type="String">
deleted_lines: style="query" required="false" type="xsd:string">

commit_message:
Switch to testr from pytest

Align to the other Openstack project and
use testr instead of pytest

Includes:
    - pylint and pep8 fixes.
    - py34 compliance
    - requirements updated
    - updated path to dsvm gate job

Change-Id: I10a5ea8d581029eba8f3ab5e016a1dd1919fa117
Depends-On: I4f9050cd551e87d2e398b6f94dc904154d0b1b13

added_lines: scenarios, `Strategies`_ might use machine learning models, which can be trained and evaluated using external machine learning engines.Today, the `Strategy`_ implementation is free to use any algorithm or any external framework in order to achieve a given `Goal`_. There is no standard interface or API which would help to share these algorithms or frameworks between different `Strategies`_. It should be possible to implement scoring engines independently from `Strategies`_. Once implemented prediction or classifier could be shared and re-used allowing to implement more advanced `Strategies`_, which could even use multiple scoring engines.
deleted_lines: scenarios, `Strategies`_ might use machine learning models, which can be trained and evaluated using external machine learning engines.Today, the `Strategy`_ implementation is free to use any algorithm or any external framework in order to achieve a given `Goal`_. There is no standard interface or API which would help to share these algorithms or frameworks between different `Strategies`_. It should be possible to implement scoring engines independently from `Strategies`_. Once implemented prediction or classifier could be shared and re-used allowing to implement more advanced `Strategies`_, which could even use multiple scoring engines.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-17 19:30:17.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/unit/v2/test_image_members_resource.py', 'glance/api/v2/image_members.py', 'releasenotes/notes/prefer-member-id-in-image-member-create-v2-f4d15ff553d274d7.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/0af1c73bbbafa27d167019f2ef5e8ea33a482c82', 'message': 'Accept member_id in v2 Image Member Create

The v2 Image Member Create schema has only ever accepted member_id as a
value in the POST body. The documented POST body and the request
deserializer, however, only ever looked for member. This adds support
for member_id without breaking the existing usage of member. This also
chooses to prefer member_id to member if both are provided

APIImpact
DocImpact

commit_message:
Accept member_id in v2 Image Member Create

The v2 Image Member Create schema has only ever accepted member_id as a
value in the POST body. The documented POST body and the request
deserializer, however, only ever looked for member. This adds support
for member_id without breaking the existing usage of member. This also
chooses to prefer member_id to member if both are provided

APIImpact
DocImpact
Co-Authored-By: Kamil Rykowski <kamil.rykowski@intel.com>
Closes-bug: #1526991

Change-Id: Ia0c677de3ea585c3d4aee5b81b7621d05042001c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/60/259160/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- deprecations: - Use of the "member" attribute in the v2 Image Member Create call is now deprecated. Use "member_id" instead. fixes: - Previously, the schema for v2 Image Member Create specified that "member_id" should be provided in the body of the request. This, however, was ignored and only "member" was accepted. "member_id" and "member" are now both accepted for backwards compatibility. If both are provided, "member_id" will be preferred.

commit_message:
VMware: Add vmware-limits metadata definitions

This patch adds the following metadata definitions (image and flavor)
for vmware-limits feature.

disk_io_reservation, disk_io_limit, disk_io_shares_share,
disk_io_shares_level, vif_reservation, vif_limit, vif_shares_share,
vif_shares_level, memory_reservation, memory_limit, memory_shares_share,
memory_shares_level, cpu_reservation, cpu_limit, cpu_shares_share,
cpu_shares_level

UpgradeImpact
OS::Compute::VMwareQuotaFlavor namespace is deprecated.
The properties "quota:cpu_limit" and "quota:cpu_reservation"
are now moved under OS::Compute::VMwareQuota namespace.

DocImpact
New metadata namespace "OS::Compute::VMwareQuota" added.
Release notes added in this patch itself.

Depends-On: I5e955ec7da038dff54f00b2534667a5d69b7d9f3
Change-Id: I24dc4965d0888098dc91ca1e82d3f5b6cde29a9e
Fixes-Bug: #1517643

added_lines: { "namespace": "OS::Compute::VMwareQuota", "display_name": "VMware Quota", "description": "The VMware compute driver allows various compute quotas. When specified, the VMWare driver will ensure that the quota is enforced. These are properties specific to VMWare compute drivers and will only have an effect if the VMWare compute driver is enabled in Nova. For flavor customization, see: http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/content/customize-flavors.html and for image customization, see: http://docs.openstack.org/image-guide/content/image-metadata.html", "visibility": "public", "protected": true, "resource_type_associations": [ { "name": "OS::Nova::Flavor", "prefix": "quota:" }, { "name": "OS::Glance::Image", "prefix": "quota_" } ], "properties": { "cpu_limit": { "title": "Quota: CPU Limit", "description": "Specifies the upper limit for CPU allocation in MHz. This parameter ensures that a machine never uses more than the defined amount of CPU time. It can be used to enforce a limit on the machine's CPU performance. The value should be a numerical value in MHz. If zero is supplied then the cpu_limit is unlimited.", "type": "integer", "minimum": 0 }, "cpu_reservation": { "title": "Quota: CPU Reservation", "description": "Specifies the guaranteed minimum CPU reservation in MHz. This means, even during resource contention, the machine will definitely get the reserved amount of CPU cycles. The value should be a numerical value in MHz.", "type": "integer", "minimum": 0 }, "cpu_shares_level": { "title": "Quota: CPU Shares Level", "description": "Specifies shares level which maps to pre-defined numeric value of shares. When 'custom' level is selected, cpu_shares_share should be specified.", "type": "string", "default": "normal", "enum": [ "low", "normal", "high", "custom" ] }, "cpu_shares_share": { "title": "Quota: CPU Shares Value", "description": "Specifies number of shares allocated. This value is used only when CPU shares level is set to custom, otherwise this value is ignored. There is no unit for this value.", "type": "integer", "minimum": 0 }, "memory_limit": { "title": "Quota: Memory Limit", "description": "Specifies the upper limit for memory allocation in MB. This parameter ensures that a machine never uses more than the defined amount of memory. The value should be a numerical value in MB. If zero is supplied then the memory_limit is unlimited.", "type": "integer", "minimum": 0 }, "memory_reservation": { "title": "Quota: Memory Reservation", "description": "Specifies the guaranteed minimum memory reservation in MB. The ensures that machine will get reserved amount of memory even during resource contention. The value should be a numerical value in MB.", "type": "integer", "minimum": 0 }, "memory_shares_level": { "title": "Quota: Memory Shares Level", "description": "Specifies shares level which maps to pre-defined numeric value of shares. When 'custom' level is selected, memory_shares_share should be specified.", "type": "string", "default": "normal", "enum": [ "low", "normal", "high", "custom" ] }, "memory_shares_share": { "title": "Quota: Memory Shares Value", "description": "Specifies number of shares allocated. This value is used only when memory shares level is set to custom, otherwise this value is ignored. There is no unit for this value.", "type": "integer", "minimum": 0 }, "disk_io_limit": { "title": "Quota: Disk IO Limit", "description": "Specifies the upper limit for disk transactions in IOPS. This parameter ensures that a machine never uses more than the defined amount of disk IOPS. It can be used to enforce a limit on the machine's disk performance. The value should be a numerical value in IOPS. If zero is supplied then the disk_io_limit is unlimited.", "type": "integer", "minimum": 0 }, "disk_io_reservation": { "title": "Quota: Disk IO Reservation", "description": "Specifies the guaranteed minimum disk transactions in IOPS. This ensures that machine will get reserved amount of disk IOPS even during resource contention. The value should be a numerical value in IOPS.", "type": "integer", "minimum": 0 }, "disk_io_shares_level": { "title": "Quota: Disk IO Shares Level", "description": "Specifies shares level which maps to pre-defined numeric value of shares. When 'custom' level is selected, disk_io_shares_share should be specified.", "type": "string", "default": "normal", "enum": [ "low", "normal", "high", "custom" ] }, "disk_io_shares_share": { "title": "Quota: Disk IO Shares Value", "description": "Specifies number of shares allocated. This value is used only when disk IO shares level is set to custom, otherwise this value is ignored. There is no unit for this value.", "type": "integer", "minimum": 0 }, "vif_limit": { "title": "Quota: VIF Limit", "description": "Specifies the upper limit for VIF bandwidth in Mbps. This parameter ensures that a virtual adapter never uses more than the defined amount of bandwidth. It can be used to enforce a limit on the VIF's performance. The value should be a numerical value in Mbps. If zero is supplied then the vif_limit is unlimited.", "type": "integer", "minimum": 0 }, "vif_reservation": { "title": "Quota: VIF Reservation Limit", "description": "Specifies the guaranteed minimum bandwidth for VIF in Mbps. This ensures that virtual adapter on the machine will get reserved amount of bandwidth even during resource contention. If utilization is less than reservation, then the resource can be used by other virtual adapters. The value should be a numerical value in Mbps", "type": "integer", "minimum": 0 }, "vif_shares_level": { "title": "Quota: VIF Shares Level", "description": "Specifies shares level which maps to pre-defined numeric value of shares. When 'custom' level is selected, vif_shares_share should be specified.", "type": "string", "default": "normal", "enum": [ "low", "normal", "high", "custom" ] }, "vif_shares_share": { "title": "Quota: VIF Shares Value", "description": "Specifies number of shares allocated. This value is used only when VIF shares level is set to custom, otherwise this value is ignored. There is no unit for this value.", "type": "integer", "minimum": 0 } } }

commit_message:
Validate string limit for input parameter

If property name with more than 255 characters is passed during
image create/update, then it raises 500 error to user.

Added a check to validate string limit and return 400 if it exceeds
the limit.

ApiImpact: For image create/update 400 response will be returned.

Partial-Bug: 1465510
Change-Id: I75f3316a1b9f433abf049fbc69aa5f597398ca50
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/48/203948/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_update_with_max_limit_property_name(self): request = unit_test_utils.get_fake_request() key = 'a' * 255 changes = [{'op': 'add', 'path': [key], 'value': 'fedora'}] output = self.controller.update(request, UUID1, changes) self.assertEqual(UUID1, output.image_id) self.assertEqual({key: 'fedora'}, output.extra_properties) self.assertNotEqual(output.created_at, output.updated_at) def test_create_image_with_max_limit_string_for_key(self): request = unit_test_utils.get_fake_request() image = {'name': 'image-1'} key = 'a' * 255 extra_properties = {key: 'value1'} output = self.controller.create(request, image=image, extra_properties=extra_properties, tags=[]) self.assertEqual('image-1', output.name) self.assertEqual(extra_properties, output.extra_properties) self.assertEqual(set([]), output.tags) def test_create_with_too_long_property_name(self): request = unit_test_utils.get_fake_request() key = 'a' * 256 request.body = jsonutils.dumps({key: 'bar'}) self.assertRaises(webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest, self.deserializer.create, request) def test_update_with_too_long_property_name(self): request = unit_test_utils.get_fake_request() request.content_type = 'application/openstack-images-v2.1-json-patch' key = 'a' * 256 doc = [{'op': 'add', 'path': key, 'value': 'bar'}] request.body = jsonutils.dumps(doc) self.assertRaises(webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest, self.deserializer.update, request)

subject: Metadef ORM classes should use a common delete for consistency
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-20 02:52:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/fbb3da5a7b7dfa017a8f56a220b5de4a65ed445b', 'message': 'Metadef ORM classes should use a common delete for consistency

The metadef db delete functions typically have code like this:
session.delete(db_rec)
session.flush()

To be consistent with the ORM classes save() function
implementation, it would be better to add a delete function
to the base metadef ORM class (i.e., GlanceMetadefBase).

Background - Both GlanceBase and GlanceMetadefBase ORM classes
call oslo.db.sqlalchemy.models.ModelBase.save() for create/update.
There is no function for hard deletes in ModelBase.

The ModelBase.save function is simply:
def save(self, session)
    with session.begin(subtransactions=True):
        session.add(self)
        session.flush()
Note: See comments in ModelBase.save for more details.

Changes -
1. The GlanceMetadefBase.delete() function was added
and is patterned after the oslo ModelBase.save() function.
2. Metadef ORM delete functions were modified to use
db_rec.delete(session=session).
3. In namespace.py, the delete function was removed as
only delete_cascade is supported.
4. In resource_type.py, the delete function was modified
to explicitly look to see if the resource_type is still
used in a namespace association rather than trying to
check for a specific db exception which might indicate
this condition.

Change-Id: Icb7df8fc9edc3f80fcd681365c5a295d72817e95
Closes-Bug: 1371837
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-29 21:43:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/0b575b13f8a900d4e87320f31c2e726ee60d16fd', 'message': 'Metadef ORM classes should use a common delete for consistency

The metadef db delete functions typically have code like this:
session.delete(db_rec)
session.flush()

To be consistent with the ORM classes save() function
implementation, it would be better to add a delete function
to the base metadef ORM class (i.e., GlanceMetadefBase).

Background - Both GlanceBase and GlanceMetadefBase ORM classes
call oslo.db.sqlalchemy.models.ModelBase.save() for create/update.
There is no function for hard deletes in ModelBase.

The ModelBase.save function is simply:
def save(self, session)
    with session.begin(subtransactions=True):
        session.add(self)
        session.flush()
Note: See comments in ModelBase.save for more details.

Changes -
1. The GlanceMetadefBase.delete() function was added
and is patterned after the oslo ModelBase.save() function.
2. Metadef ORM delete functions were modified to use
db_rec.delete(session=session).
3. In namespace.py, the delete function was removed as
only delete_cascade is supported.
4. In resource_type.py, the delete function was modified
to explicitly look to see if the resource_type is still
used in a namespace association rather than trying to
check for a specific db exception which might indicate
this condition.

Change-Id: Icb7df8fc9edc3f80fcd681365c5a295d72817e95
Closes-Bug: 1371837

commit_message:
Metadef ORM classes should use a common delete for consistency

The metadef db delete functions typically have code like this:
session.delete(db_rec)
session.flush()

To be consistent with the ORM classes save() function
implementation, it would be better to add a delete function
to the base metadef ORM class (i.e., GlanceMetadefBase).

Background - Both GlanceBase and GlanceMetadefBase ORM classes
call oslo.db.sqlalchemy.models.ModelBase.save() for create/update.
There is no function for hard deletes in ModelBase.

The ModelBase.save function is simply:
def save(self, session)
    with session.begin(subtransactions=True):
        session.add(self)
        session.flush()
Note: See comments in ModelBase.save for more details.

Changes -
1. The GlanceMetadefBase.delete() function was added
and is patterned after the oslo ModelBase.save() function.
2. Metadef ORM delete functions were modified to use
db_rec.delete(session=session).
3. In namespace.py, the delete function was removed as
only delete_cascade is supported.
4. In resource_type.py, the delete function was modified
to explicitly look to see if the resource_type is still
used in a namespace association rather than trying to
check for a specific db exception which might indicate
this condition.

Change-Id: Icb7df8fc9edc3f80fcd681365c5a295d72817e95
Closes-Bug: 1371837
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/10/122910/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: metadef_api.object.delete_namespace_content( context, namespace_rec.id, session) metadef_api.property.delete_namespace_content( context, namespace_rec.id, session) metadef_api.resource_type_association.delete_namespace_content( context, namespace_rec.id, session) namespace_rec.delete(session=session)

" Other records still refer to it." % name) LOG.debug(msg) raise exc.MetadefIntegrityError( record_type='namespace', record_name=name) else: raise e return namespace_rec.as_dict() try: metadef_api.object.delete_namespace_content( context, namespace_rec.id, session) metadef_api.property.delete_namespace_content( context, namespace_rec.id, session) metadef_api.resource_type_association.delete_namespace_content( context, namespace_rec.id, session) session.delete(namespace_rec) session.flush() except db_exc.DBError as e: if isinstance(e.inner_exception, sa_exc.IntegrityError): msg = ("Metadata definition namespace=%s not deleted." " Other records still refer to it." % name) LOG.debug(msg) raise exc.MetadefIntegrityError( record_type='namespace', record_name=name) else: raise e

commit_message:
Move lockutils-wrapper into .testr.conf

Without this the wrapper is not present when running testr directly,
which should be supported. As far as I know there's no intent for
multiple test backends to be working with each others files, they all
start separate servers etc, so having separate lock contexts for them
all should be fine. If this is not the case - well, -1 the patch, but
I think that would indicate very poor isolation hygiene in the test
suite and we'd want to fix that. Ideally the lock stuff would be
within the Python code, but I wanted to fix the immediate issue.

Change-Id: Ib547d8b62b97e6dd58703422b34dd7ffef811b5d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/86/252086/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: commands = python setup.py testr --slowest --testr-args='{posargs}'commands = python setup.py testr --slowest --testr-args='glance.tests.unit'
deleted_lines: commands = lockutils-wrapper python setup.py testr --slowest --testr-args='{posargs}'commands = lockutils-wrapper python setup.py testr --slowest --testr-args='glance.tests.unit'

commit_message:
Race condition in keystone domain config

This bug fixes a race condition in the domains_config
decorator. The race condition occurs when more than
one thread accesses the decorator. The first thread
sets the configured flag to True before proceeding with
driver load leading the second thread to use the default
driver. This fix ensures that the second thread waits for
the first thread to finish configuration before it uses
the driver.

Change-Id: I0289a4d38e0d30d39c67e29bf77b0a89d1dd23f6
Closes-Bug: 1549726
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/20/287020/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from threading import Lock lock = Lock() self.configured = True # If domain specific driver has not been configured, # acquire the lock and proceed with loading the driver self.domain_configs.lock.acquire() try: # Check again just in case some other thread # has already completed domain config if (not self.domain_configs.configured): self.domain_configs.setup_domain_drivers( self.driver, self.resource_api) finally: self.domain_configs.lock.release() return f(self, *args, **kwargs)
deleted_lines: self.configured = True self.domain_configs.setup_domain_drivers( self.driver, self.resource_api) return f(self, *args, **kwargs)

Change-Id: I0121fe9da5831d6186bf7954271b79a8b3a60eba
Closes-Bug: #1548724

commit_message:
Extend FakeCryptoCertificate.cert_not_valid_after to 2 hours

Someone reported this test failing on a slow CI system where
it takes 1.5 hours for their stuff to run. It doesn't seem to
matter what our fake mock expiration time is, so bump it to 2
hours.

Change-Id: I0121fe9da5831d6186bf7954271b79a8b3a60eba
Closes-Bug: #1548724

commit_message:
Install: Neutron updates for Mitaka

Update neutron content for Mitaka.

1) Change 'public' to 'provider' and 'private' to
   'self-service' to improve distinction between these
   networks using neutronish terms.
2) Remove explicit installation of some packages due to
   dependency fixes.
3) Remove explicit configuration of verbosity.
4) Remove explicit configuration of ARP spoofing protection.
5) Remove extraneous configuration for the metadata agent.
6) Remove extraneous configuration for nova-neutron
   interaction.
7) Reduce discussion of MTU because Mitaka fixes most
   of the issues, but we still need to explain the
   most limitation of overlay networks.
8) Generally improve wording.

Implements: blueprint installguide-mitaka
Change-Id: I3beff125b2eb8d264048530dc3bad7d346d2828b

added_lines: neutron-metadata-agent conntrack openstack-neutron-linuxbridge ebtables openstack-neutron-metadata-agent * In the ``[ml2]`` section, enable VXLAN self-service networks: * In the ``[ml2_type_flat]`` section, configure the provider virtual network as a flat network: flat_networks = provider range for self-service networks:networking infrastructure for instances and handles security groups. * In the ``[linux_bridge]`` section, map the provider virtual network to the provider physical network interface: physical_interface_mappings = provider:PROVIDER_INTERFACE_NAME Replace ``PROVIDER_INTERFACE_NAME`` with the name of the underlying provider physical network interface. See :ref:`environment-networking` for more information. the management IP address of the controller node. See :ref:`environment-networking` for more information.The :term:`Layer-3 (L3) agent` provides routing and NAT services for self-service virtual networks. Dnsmasq DHCP driver, and enable isolated metadata so instances on provider
deleted_lines: neutron-metadata-agent python-neutronclient conntrack openstack-neutron-linuxbridge python-neutronclient ebtables ipset openstack-neutron-metadata-agent ipset nova_url = http://controller:8774/v2 * (Optional) To assist with troubleshooting, enable verbose logging in the ``[DEFAULT]`` section: .. code-block:: ini [DEFAULT] ... verbose = True * In the ``[ml2]`` section, enable VXLAN project (private) networks: * In the ``[ml2_type_flat]`` section, configure the public flat provider network: flat_networks = public range for private networks:networking infrastructure for instances including VXLAN tunnels for private networks and handles security groups. * In the ``[linux_bridge]`` section, map the public virtual network to the public physical network interface: physical_interface_mappings = public:PUBLIC_INTERFACE_NAME Replace ``PUBLIC_INTERFACE_NAME`` with the name of the underlying physical public network interface. each node's own management IP address. * In the ``[agent]`` section, enable ARP spoofing protection: .. code-block:: ini [agent] ... prevent_arp_spoofing = TrueThe :term:`Layer-3 (L3) agent` provides routing and NAT services for virtual networks. * (Optional) To assist with troubleshooting, enable verbose logging in the ``[DEFAULT]`` section: .. code-block:: ini [DEFAULT] ... verbose = True Dnsmasq DHCP driver, and enable isolated metadata so instances on public * (Optional) To assist with troubleshooting, enable verbose logging in the ``[DEFAULT]`` section: .. code-block:: ini [DEFAULT] ... verbose = True Overlay networks such as VXLAN include additional packet headers that increase overhead and decrease space available for the payload or user data. Without knowledge of the virtual network infrastructure, instances attempt to send packets using the default Ethernet :term:`maximum transmission unit (MTU)` of 1500 bytes. :term:`Internet protocol (IP)` networks contain the :term:`path MTU discovery (PMTUD)` mechanism to detect end-to-end MTU and adjust packet size accordingly. However, some operating systems and networks block or otherwise lack support for PMTUD causing performance degradation or connectivity failure. Ideally, you can prevent these problems by enabling :term:`jumbo frames <jumbo frame>` on the physical network that contains your tenant virtual networks. Jumbo frames support MTUs up to approximately 9000 bytes which negates the impact of VXLAN overhead on virtual networks. However, many network devices lack support for jumbo frames and OpenStack administrators often lack control over network infrastructure. Given the latter complications, you can also prevent MTU problems by reducing the instance MTU to account for VXLAN overhead. Determining the proper MTU value often takes experimentation, but 1450 bytes works in most environments. You can configure the DHCP server that assigns IP addresses to your instances to also adjust the MTU. .. note:: Some cloud images ignore the DHCP MTU option in which case you should configure it using metadata, a script, or other suitable method. * In the ``[DEFAULT]`` section, enable the :term:`dnsmasq` configuration file: .. code-block:: ini [DEFAULT] ... dnsmasq_config_file = /etc/neutron/dnsmasq-neutron.conf * Create and edit the ``/etc/neutron/dnsmasq-neutron.conf`` file to enable the DHCP MTU option (26) and configure it to 1450 bytes: .. code-block:: ini dhcp-option-force=26,1450

commit_message:
Cap bashate and fix linters tests

Bashate is pinned to ensure that for the rest of the cycle, and
once this becomes a stable branch, there are no code changes
needed for updates to the linting tool.

Also, the tox configuration is updated to ensure that it consumes
the dev-requirements file for all lint testing.

Finally, a H404 & H405 PEP8 violation is resolved in a python
script.

Change-Id: I78056d1d22228f073c44e9ee4e78534a4010effe
(cherry picked from commit 13bea329896c82a8352633038090f31e09ef7afd)

commit_message:
Check correct minimum size for data disk

Currently we choose the largest available disk as the data disk, however
this may be too small to be useful. This patch checks disqualifies disks
that are smaller than the minimum.

It also sets the minimum to the proper value of 60GB free on the root
disk or 60GB available on the designated secondary disk. The previous
check was 60GB on root and 80GB on the secondary disk which is not
the intented check as noted in the documentation.

(cherry picked from commit ec14005f7608727896ac21877679d825b557a75a)

Conflicts:
	tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/check-requirements.yml

Change-Id: Id225dc55068e1eed2e19e1e27b0f626163f03db2

commit_message:
Add initial spec file for oslo.concurrency

* Re-written using new syntax
* Add lower bounds according to requirements
* Rebase

Co-Authored-by: Thomas Bechtold <tbechtold@suse.com>

commit_message:
In the service lock, reset the service, not the lock

It turns out that when you're in a context manager that has gotten the
lock, attempting to set that lock to None will fail. It's also not the
thing we actually want to do. What we WANT to do is reset the _service_
so that we'll ensure a new service object gets created.

Change-Id: Ic39ef0418dcd5c0cbbe710ac1c31e58b744f56b5

commit_message:
Use wraps decorator on client methods

This adds a functools.wraps call on APIParamsCall, so that docstring is
propagated properly.

Change-Id: Ie951536b0bf4e1a9af386def920a1e16931de62e

commit_message:
Remove a vol in error state from a CG

Before calling update_consistencygroup, a validation is done if volumes
are in valid states for action.

Divide the states allowed for adding and removing volumes from a CG,
and allow volume removal in states error and error_deleting.

Also added missing verification in manager update_consistencygroup in
case state has changed from cinder-api to cinder-volume.

Change-Id: I6f5fa8e9af67e17ab49e7f3423d4469640df790c
Closes-Bug: #1519377

subject: Change the private subnet of the overcloud tenant network
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-08 00:54:42.000000000', 'files': ['templates/tenantvm_floatingip.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/cf2f8f040015bd918c1a592dda78a68484960a0d', 'message': "Change the private subnet of the overcloud tenant network

We use 10.0.0.0/24 as the default subnet for the overcloud external
network; the recent change to enable netiso in CI [1] is setting
10.0.0.0/24 as the default floating network for the overcloud,
so that we can ping float Ips from the undercloud (which has a leg
on the external network).

We can't use 10.0.0.0/8 as the private subnet for the overcloud tenant
though network as it conflicts with the floating network, causing errors
like:

Cidr 10.0.0.0/8 of subnet 126de4ce-644f-4fb4-84db-3fb6142d8f9c overlaps with cidr 10.0.0.0/24

This change switches the overcloud tenant network subnet to
192.168.2.0/24 so that it won't conflict.

1. I830755d7d882d155813c105dff76900e6675cca2

Change-Id: Ie21282eb8cc0a8767aceb270bb1c892cec51bf73
(cherry picked from commit 2938259327a1312c107aaa7349ec60d50334c95b)
"}]
commit_message:
Change the private subnet of the overcloud tenant network

We use 10.0.0.0/24 as the default subnet for the overcloud external
network; the recent change to enable netiso in CI [1] is setting
10.0.0.0/24 as the default floating network for the overcloud,
so that we can ping float Ips from the undercloud (which has a leg
on the external network).

We can't use 10.0.0.0/8 as the private subnet for the overcloud tenant
though network as it conflicts with the floating network, causing errors
like:

Cidr 10.0.0.0/8 of subnet 126de4ce-644f-4fb4-84db-3fb6142d8f9c overlaps with cidr 10.0.0.0/24

This change switches the overcloud tenant network subnet to
192.168.2.0/24 so that it won't conflict.

1. I830755d7d882d155813c105dff76900e6675cca2

Change-Id: Ie21282eb8cc0a8767aceb270bb1c892cec51bf73
(cherry picked from commit 2938259327a1312c107aaa7349ec60d50334c95b)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-07 18:04:14.000000000', 'files': ['templates/tenantvm_floatingip.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/2938259327a1312c107aaa7349ec60d50334c95b', 'message': "Change the private subnet of the overcloud tenant network

so that we can ping float Ips from the undercloud (which has a leg

commit_message:
Change the private subnet of the overcloud tenant network

We use 10.0.0.0/24 as the default subnet for the overcloud external
network; the recent change to enable netiso in CI [1] is setting
10.0.0.0/24 as the default floating network for the overcloud,
so that we can ping float Ips from the undercloud (which has a leg
on the external network).

We can't use 10.0.0.0/8 as the private subnet for the overcloud tenant
though network as it conflicts with the floating network, causing errors
like:

Cidr 10.0.0.0/8 of subnet 126de4ce-644f-4fb4-84db-3fb6142d8f9c overlaps with cidr 10.0.0.0/24

This change switches the overcloud tenant network subnet to
192.168.2.0/24 so that it won't conflict.

1. I830755d7d882d155813c105dff76900e6675cca2

Change-Id: Ie21282eb8cc0a8767aceb270bb1c892cec51bf73
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/89/289489/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

function uploadFileChunked(url, file, chunkSize, token, callback) { var deferred = $.Deferred(); var config = { 'X-Auth-Token': token, 'Transfer-Encoding': 'chunked' processData: false // tell jQuery not to process the data }; var startIndex = 0; var size = file.size; sendChunk(); return deferred.promise; function wrappedCallback() { return callback(size, startIndex); } function done() { deferred.resolve(); } function fail() { deferred.reject(); } function sendChunk() { var reader; var chunk = getNextChunk(); if (!chunk.size) { config.data = '0

'; $.ajax(config).done(wrappedCallback, done).fail(fail); } else { reader = new FileReader(); reader.onload = function(evt) { config.data = chunk.size + '
' + evt.target.result + '
'; $.ajax(config).done(wrappedCallback, sendChunk).fail(fail); }; reader.readAsBinaryString(chunk); } } function getNextChunk() { var chunk; var endIndex = startIndex + chunkSize; if ( endIndex > size ) { endIndex = size; } chunk = file.slice(startIndex, endIndex); startIndex = endIndex; return chunk; } } horizon.modals.asyncUpload = function(uploadInfo, jqXHR) { var objId = horizon.modals._getAsyncHeader(jqXHR); var token = jqXHR.getResponseHeader('X-Auth-Token'); var url = uploadInfo.urlPrefix + objId; var file = uploadInfo.file; var size = file.size; var DEFAULT_CHUNK_SIZE = 5 * 1024 * 1024; var chunkSize = DEFAULT_CHUNK_SIZE; var MODERN_BROWSERS_STACK_DEPTH_LIMIT = 5000; if ( size / DEFAULT_CHUNK_SIZE > MODERN_BROWSERS_STACK_DEPTH_LIMIT ) { chunkSize = size / MODERN_BROWSERS_STACK_DEPTH_LIMIT; } horizon.modals.progress_bar(gettext("Uploading image")); uploadFileChunked(url, file, chunkSize, token, function(totalSize, sizeSent) { horizon.modals.progress_bar.update(sizeSent / totalSize);
deleted_lines: horizon.modals.asyncUpload = function(uploadInfo, jqXHR) { var objId = horizon.modals._getAsyncHeader(jqXHR); var token = jqXHR.getResponseHeader('X-Auth-Token'); var url = uploadInfo.urlPrefix + objId; var formData = new FormData(); formData.append('files[]', uploadInfo.file, uploadInfo.file.name); horizon.modals.progress_bar(gettext("Uploading image")); return $.ajax({ 'X-Auth-Token': token data: formData, processData: false, // tell jQuery not to process the data xhr: function() { var xhr = new window.XMLHttpRequest(); xhr.upload.addEventListener('progress', function(evt) { if (evt.lengthComputable) { horizon.modals.progress_bar.update(evt.loaded / evt.total); } }, false); return xhr; }

commit_message:
Bypass repo server if missing pip upgrade packages

The function get_pip upgrades the pip packages for pip. If OSA is
updated to require newer versions these may not be present on the repo
server and this will cause bootstrap-ansible.sh to fail.

Update the get_pip function to fallback on calling pip with the
--isolated flag when pip is installed and the pip packages are being
upgraded.

Change-Id: Ifa644b9bf6aa8b20028eb0257c40fe20f3ab1a3b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/17/289317/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # If this fails retry with --isolated to bypass the repo server because the repo server will not have # been updated at this point to include any newer pip packages. pip install --upgrade ${PIP_INSTALL_OPTIONS} || pip install --upgrade --isolated ${PIP_INSTALL_OPTIONS}
deleted_lines: pip install --upgrade ${PIP_INSTALL_OPTIONS}

commit_message:
Fix ubuntu marathon container

When we install mesos if it(or some deps) doesn't find java it installs
gcj(java5) which generate cacerts, so later in marathon we have
situation that openjdk8 can't access(discover as broken) to it because
of different format. Additionaly this third-party openjdk8 has in
dependencies ca-certificates-java which need java to generate cacerts
file.

Change-Id: Ic4467529a842ffc4bdd99ac1e23abbdee3a82422
Closes-bug: #1552626
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/44/288144/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(ajafo) installation marathon/openjdk break cacerts file # so there is purge and install ca-certificates-java # as workaround for this problem && dpkg --purge --force-depends ca-certificates-java \ && apt-get install ca-certificates-java \
